intro: Lepidium polycladum, commonly known as the clustered cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and has small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Lepidium polycladum is often found in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to survive in harsh conditions.
